byline.contributor: Jim Dwyer and Patrick McGeehan contributed reporting.
byline.original: By KATE ZERNIKE and JAD MOUAWAD

abstract: United Airlines chief executive Jeff Smisek resigns along with two other senior officials due to federal investigation into whether airline exchanged favors with Port Authority of New York and New Jersey chairman David Samson; Oscar Munoz will take over as president and chief executive; investigation is outgrowth of George Washington Bridge lane-closing scandal involving administration of New Jersey Gov Chris Christie.
lead_paragraph: The airline said two other executives were also leaving in connection with an investigation into whether flights were a favor for a top agency official.

headline.main: United C.E.O. Is Out Amid Inquiry at Port Authority
headline.print_headline: United C.E.O. Out Amid U.S. Inquiry Into Port Agency

snippet: The airline said two other executives were also leaving in connection with an investigation into whether flights were a favor for a top agency official.

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations
